thread.title: Mets defeat Dodgers, advance to play Cubs in National League Championship Series
thread.title_full: Mets defeat Dodgers, advance to play Cubs in National League Championship Series

author: Beth Harris
title: Mets defeat Dodgers, advance to play Cubs in National League Championship Series
text:
Baseball Mets defeat Dodgers, advance to play Cubs in National League Championship Series New York Mets starting pitcher Jacob deGrom, above right, catcher Travis d’Arnaud, left, and other Mets players celebrate a 3-2 win over the Los Angeles Dodgers in Game 5 of baseball’s National League Division Series on Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, ... more > By Beth Harris - Associated Press   
LOS ANGELES — Daniel Murphy and the New York Mets caught the Los Angeles Dodgers sleeping. 
Murphy stole an uncovered third base and went on to score the tying run, then hit a go-ahead home run off Zack Greinke to lead the Mets over the Dodgers , 3-2, on Thursday night and into an National League Championship Series matchup with the Chicago Cubs. 
New York trailed, 2-1, in the decisive Game 5 of the NL Division Series when, with three infielders on the right side and no one near third, Murphy strolled to second on Lucas Duda’s fourth-inning walk and sprinted to third. Travis d’Arnaud followed with a sacrifice fly. 
Murphy hit a home run in the sixth for a 3-2 lead. He went 3-for-3 against Greinke, the Dodgers ‘ No. 2 pitcher who couldn’t stave off elimination for the second consecutive game. Murphy hit .333 in the series and hit three home runs off Greinke and Clayton Kershaw. 
The Mets will host the Cubs in Game 1 on Saturday night. The two teams have never met in the postseason. 
Jacob deGrom allowed runners in his first five innings, but RBI singles by Justin Turner and Andre Ethier put the Dodgers ahead, 2-1, in the first. DeGrom (2-0), the NL Rookie of the Year last season, struck out seven batters and walked three to earn his second road win of the series. 
Noah Syndergaard pitched the seventh in the rookie’s first big-league relief appearance, and Jeurys Familia got the first six-out save of his career. Familia retired pinch-hitter Chase Utley — who earned the Mets ‘ wrath after his takeout slide broke shortstop Ruben Tejada’s leg in Game 2 — on a flyout. 
Playing on the 27th anniversary of Kirk Gibson’s World Series home run, Los Angeles failed to come up with a big drive, going 0-for-11 with runners in scoring positions. 
Despite a record $289 million payroll, the Dodgers remained without a World Series title since 1988. 
Greinke (1-1) gave up three runs and six hits in 6 2/3 innings. The right-hander, who led the majors with a 1.66 ERA, struck out nine and walked one 
Murphy doubled in the Mets ‘ first run in the first, but the Dodgers went ahead with four consecutive singles in the bottom half. 
Los Angeles failed to capitalize with two runners on in the second and third. After Justin Turner led off the third inning with a double, Andre Ethier followed with a popup to left. 
Ethier returned the dugout and began yelling at Mattingly while simultaneously walking away from him. Mattingly followed, and twice Ethier turned towards Mattingly and yelled at him while gesturing angrily with his arms, pointing twice at the field and twice directly at Mattingly. 
Ethier remained in the game and went out to right field for the fourth. 
Turner had a pair of doubles, giving him a franchise playoff-record six in one series.
